definition: countable noun (in grammar of European languages)
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
uncountable noun (in grammar of European languages)

sentences.english: Count nouns can be used with numbers.
sentences.chinese: 可数名词可与数字连用。

sentences.english: The word "person" is a countable noun.
'Walk', 'jog', and 'run' are also used as both verbs and countable nouns. They refer to travel on foot.
sentences.chinese: Jog和Run都可以用作动词和可数名词。

sentences.english: There is no room for me to stand in the bus.
sentences.chinese: 在此是不可数名词，表示“地方，空间”。

sentences.english: This is an uncountable noun. It has no plural form .
sentences.chinese: 这是个不可数名词，没有复数形式。

sentences.english: To recognize and use the indefinite articles to talk about things that are countable.
sentences.chinese: 识别并使用不定冠词谈论可数名词。

sentences.english: Singular count nouns always take a determiner.
sentences.chinese: 可数名词单数前需用限定词。

sentences.english: Plural count nouns do not need a determiner.
sentences.chinese: 可数名词复数前不需用限定词。

sentences.english: Most uncountable nouns are only used in the singular.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的不可数名词只有单数的形式。

sentences.english: Countable nouns have singular and plural forms.
sentences.chinese: 可数名词有单数和复数之分。

sentences.english: To learn the general rules of countable and uncountable nouns.
sentences.chinese: 学习符合规则的可数和不可数名词。

sentences.english: Numerals limit the quantities or sequence of countable nouns.
sentences.chinese: 数字限制可数名词的数量或次序。

sentences.english: Uncount nouns have only one form , and take a singular verb.
sentences.chinese: 不可数名词只有一种形式，与动词的单数搭配。

sentences.english: The word is an uncountable noun and is used in a general sense, hence it takes no article.
sentences.chinese: 这字是不可数名词，又用于一般意义，所以不加冠词。

definition: uncountable noun (in grammar of European languages)
